Line 45: Line 45:
* [[Colorado#Demographics|Southern Colorado]] is home to many communities of Hispanics descended from Mexican settlers who arrived during Spanish colonial times. Roughly half of [[Pueblo, Colorado|Pueblo]]'s population is [[Latino]], mostly Mexican-American.<ref>http://www.city-data.com/city/Pueblo-Colorado.html</ref> Many other towns in southern Colorado have high proportions of Mexican-Americans. [[La Junta, Colorado|La Junta]], [[Rocky Ford, Colorado|Rocky Ford]], [[Las Animas, Colorado|Las Animas]], [[Lamar, Colorado|Lamar]], [[Walsenburg, Colorado|Walsenburg]], and [[Trinidad, Colorado|Trinidad]] all have extremely large Mexican American communities.
* [[Colorado#Demographics|Southern Colorado]] is home to many communities of Hispanics descended from Mexican settlers who arrived during Spanish colonial times. Roughly half of [[Pueblo, Colorado|Pueblo]]'s population is [[Latino]], mostly Mexican-American.<ref>http://www.city-data.com/city/Pueblo-Colorado.html</ref> Many other towns in southern Colorado have high proportions of Mexican-Americans. [[La Junta, Colorado|La Junta]], [[Rocky Ford, Colorado|Rocky Ford]], [[Las Animas, Colorado|Las Animas]], [[Lamar, Colorado|Lamar]], [[Walsenburg, Colorado|Walsenburg]], and [[Trinidad, Colorado|Trinidad]] all have extremely large Mexican American communities.
** [[San Luis Valley]] - The San Luis Valley has many towns with large Mexican-American populations. [[Antonito, Colorado|Antonito]], [[Blanca, Colorado|Blanca]], [[Center, Colorado|Center]], [[Del Norte, Colorado|Del Norte]], [[Fort Garland, Colorado|Fort Garland]], [[Monte Vista, Colorado|Monte Vista]], and [[Romeo, Colorado|Romeo]] are all Latino majority.<ref>http://scseed.org/wb/media/SLV%20Statistical%20Profile%2012-03-07.pdf</ref>
** [[San Luis Valley]] - The San Luis Valley has many towns with large Mexican-American populations. [[Antonito, Colorado|Antonito]], [[Blanca, Colorado|Blanca]], [[Center, Colorado|Center]], [[Del Norte, Colorado|Del Norte]], [[Fort Garland, Colorado|Fort Garland]], [[Monte Vista, Colorado|Monte Vista]], and [[Romeo, Colorado|Romeo]] are all Latino majority.<ref>http://scseed.org/wb/media/SLV%20Statistical%20Profile%2012-03-07.pdf</ref>

*[[Yakima Valley AVA|The Yakima Valley]] and [[Tri-Cities, Washington]] - This region of [[Washington (state)|Washington]] contains many communities of Mexican-American majority thanks to high demand for agricultural labor.
